ygData.subject: Re: Asking for Python NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Brian, thanks for sharing your python NEAT implementation. Currently I m modifying Simmerson s Java implementation (NEAT4J) to fit my needs but my interest

Hi Brian, thanks for sharing your python NEAT implementation.

Currently I'=
m modifying Simmerson's Java implementation (NEAT4J) to
fit my needs but my=
 interest in python is increasing and I'm intending
to study yours (and Kar=
l's) python version to learn more about python
and NEAT, of course :-)

[]'=
s
Cesar

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "cchtty37" <cchtty37@...> wrote:
>
> =
Ken/Cesar,
> 
> I have been working on my own version of NEAT in Python, bu=
t it is
> still in a fairly primitive state (many bugs and some of the more=

> recent features of NEAT have not been implemented). You are more than
> =
welcome to take a look, though:
> http://code.google.com/p/pyneat/
> 
> Ple=
ase let me know if you have any feedback.
> 
> Thanks,
> Brian
> 
> --- In =
neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@> wrote:
> >
> > Cesar, I=
 agree it would be nice to make python NEAT available on the 
> > website. =
 I believe I asked Karl Lewin for permission to do that 
> > about three ye=
ars ago, but he told me the code wasn't in suitable 
> > condition to be re=
leased.  Since then, we seem to have lost touch.  
> > You are correct that=
 he is the one who produced a python NEAT version.
> > 
> > I think I remem=
ber others mentioning they were working on Python 
> > versions of NEAT but=
 I can't remember who it was.  If someone has 
> > such a version and wants=
 to make it available, I will be happy to 
> > link it from my website.
> >=
 
> > ken
> >

> wrote:
> > >
> > > Hello NEAT users,

> > > I know there's a python=
 version of NEAT not listed in Ken's website.

on the group's history I found some threads

I contacted the author (Karl Lewin) and the
> > > guy (Thomas) who was aski=
ng for the source code, but received no
> > > replies (I'm not even sure th=
ey use the same e-mail).
> > > 
> > > Web archive last Karl's website recor=
d is from 2005, but the source
> > > file (pyn.zip) is not available.
> > >=
 
> > > Does anyone have the code or is it lost forever?
> > > 
> > > @Ken,=
 wouldn't it be nice to list the python version on the website
> > > (given=
 Karl's permission)?
